forumNotes.author: Dr. Avery
forumNotes.content:
So I'm trying to find an image that will remotely boot over an intel RPAT OOB session (serial over ethernet) to a strictly text based interface, and then successfully strap up to a GUI environment and a fully functional network (with access to installed NTFS drives).  

The problem I'm running into, is that most boot images are too large for this technology. The ISO can be fairly large, but the bootable portion needs to be quite small.  

Any ideas where I should start?

is it a PXE BOOT stuff ./ ?   

personally never tested this thing . but if it is PXE ,and you have linux knowledge , then i am sure a linux live cd can do this .   

otherwise of course you have " made in home " products , vista pe , win7 pe or live xp.  

only live xp can install additional network drivers while in pe mood. minimal size can be \< 50 MB if mass storage drivers are also included.
